attributes.action: Abandon the proposal to punish car owners who need their cars to visit people in distress but do not receive pay for doing so.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Please remember the car users who are volunteers and visit people in distress but who do not receive any pay although they give their time and petrol freely.  Surely they should not be penalised!  Such an imposition would infringe not only the liberty of the driver but the person visited, when the "eye in the sky" spied on innocent folk. When offering comfort to bereaved people we would risk their privacy/confidentiality.  If we were to claim expenses from our Charities they would soon go bankrupt as it is hard enough to raise funds anyway.
PLEASE, think it through.
